alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:34PM EST until December 21 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Hallowell. * WHEN...From this evening to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, flooding enters Water St in Hallowell. Several businesses along the waterfront likely to be impacted in Hallowell and Gardiner. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:05 PM EST Monday the stage was 5.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening to 17.3 feet tomorrow afternoon. This is higher than the May flood which crested at 16.6 feet. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning to 9.3 feet Thursday morning. It will rise to 9.4 feet late Thursday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
